I'm still working out how to handle liquid fuel and oxidizer together, but I am thinking along the lines of having sections for LF, Ox, and LF/Ox. That way, you can manage LF and Ox separately, or together under LF/Ox. I am not sure how to handle the case where you want to manage LF/Ox together, but they are out of sync -- i.e. some tanks do not have the right ratio of LF to Ox.

I`d cover your bases and give the decision to the user. Maybe an option in settings (or per ship ideally so you don`t have to keep resetting it) to stop when the first resource runs out (ratio perfect) or when the last resource runs out (max transfer) depending on if you want the destination to have the right ratios or be as full as possible. Balance would work as it does now and make the tanks weigh the same ignoring ratio of LF/Ox.

Hmm, might need three settings, transfer perfect ratio (will transfer at 1:1.1 ignoring destination ratio), make destination ratio correct (forces destination ratio to be 1:1.1 with two way transfer) or max transfer (transfers as much as it can ignoring ratio)

Or there could just be the ability to say "Make the destination 55% full of LF and Ox" with a couple of sliders...
Any update on this? I am really looking forward to saving 30+ minutes re-supplying my ship at my station.

Yes, an update would be nice. At lease to fix the weird node issue introduced in .20

Add some newer features in a later release. I'm going to avoid putting it on my ships until the node issue is resolved.

Nonetheless, thanks for the work that's been done so far and please don't think I'm an impatient teenager. Just letting you know there are people eagerly awaiting your updates.

Why would you do it tomorrow either? As I noted earlier, the author is still active and is in the process of updating his library of mods. He'll get to this one soon, he's already working on new features he discussed a few posts back (maybe partless operation and LF/O2 combined transfers). Doing it today is the equivalent of, while driving the car to the junkyard for demolition, noting you're only a month away from your next scheduled oil change and deciding to get it done now. It doesn't need it now, and it's certainly not going to need it then.

Good news! The TAC Fuel Balancer version 2.0 is coming soon!

New features:

  • Edit the fuel amount before launch!
  • Dump fuel!
  • No parts needed!
  • New screen icon for opening the GUI!
  • Scroll bars!

This is still very much a work in progress and there are a few known issues:

  • The windows initially open quite small. Note that they remember the last size so it is not an issue after the first time.
  • The GUI styling is somewhat inconsistent in some areas.

Completely uninstall the old version before installing this.

Download from https://www.dropbox.com/s/4pv79rkx87s1f1v/TacFuelBalancer_pre-2.0.a.zip

Please let me know if you tried it out, and whether you had any issues. Also send me suggestions for improvements.

Thanks!

Suggestions:

- A feature to set exact amounts while transferring fuel?

- While transferring fuel, move all types of the tanks fuel to new location simultaneously (If both tanks are of the same type).

Loving it so far. I haven't done any thorough testing but from fiddling with the Kerbal-X on the launchpad it seems great so far. I might suggest making the help window start wider (if possible) currently it starts with around 20 characters(maybe less) per line and is extremely long to drag it up to find the resize button.

Otherwise, Loving the gui:

Awesome. One suggestion/request, though I don't know if it's possible:

Quick forward/back and left/right buttons for trim tanks on planes and space planes (esp with FAR). They could take any available resource and transfer it to any available container that is in the direction you click.

Even harder/more awesome would be something that looked up the center of mass when you first click it and moved fuel in the direction that will keep it the same.

Hey... if you were ever looking for a challenge... it would be great if you could somehow pull in the CoL and CoM variables, then have the fuel flow maintain a balance that keeps the CoL 5% behind the CoM (or whatever user defined value is desired).

I have been testing out the new version you posted yesterday, and I believe I may have found a bug. Any craft that should be uncontrollable, such as unmanned craft, spent rocket stages with small amounts of fuel left, probes out of range of remotetech control, all appear still to be able to transfer fuel from one section of the ship to another.

Would you consider removing this feature during your development so that only controllable craft are capable of fuel transfer, or is it something that you have intentionally kept in?
